hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: GIT_COMMIT_MESSAGE
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Commit message used for LHCI server historical purposes.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: GIT_AUTHOR
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Author used for LHCI server historical purposes (info).

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: GIT_AVATAR_URL
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Author email address used for LHCI server historical purposes (gravatar icon and info).

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: GIT_CURRENT_BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Commit branch used for LHCI server historical purposes to categorize tests.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: run_number
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: How many times you want to test each page

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: server_base_url
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The LHCI server base URL. In theory this should not change unless you have customised the docker compose file.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: upload_token
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The LHCI server project token generated by running `lhci wizard`.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
export previous_build_number=`expr $BUILD_NUMBER - 1` export current_build_number=$BUILD_NUMBER
runlhci="sudo docker run \ --network=host \ --volumes-from=jenkins \ --cap-add=NET_ADMIN \ --privileged \ --shm-size=2g \ --env LHCI_BUILD_CONTEXT__ANCESTOR_HASH='$previous_build_number' \ --env LHCI_BUILD_CONTEXT__CURRENT_HASH='$current_build_number' \ --env LHCI_BUILD_CONTEXT__COMMIT_MESSAGE='$GIT_COMMIT_MESSAGE' \ --env LHCI_BUILD_CONTEXT__AUTHOR='$GIT_AUTHOR' \ --env LHCI_BUILD_CONTEXT__AVATAR_URL='$GIT_AVATAR_URL' \ --env LHCI_BUILD_CONTEXT__COMMIT_TIME='$(date -u)' \ --env LHCI_BUILD_CONTEXT__CURRENT_BRANCH='$GIT_CURRENT_BRANCH' \ --rm \ -v \ $(echo $LHCI_REPORT_PATH):/home/lhci/reports/.lighthouseci performance-testing-framework_lhci-client \ lhci autorun --collect.numberOfRuns=$run_number --collect.url=$URL --upload.serverBaseUrl=$server_base_url --upload.token=$upload_token"
eval $runlhci
sudo rm -rf "$WORKSPACE/lhci_report" && sudo mkdir "$WORKSPACE/lhci_report" cd "/var/lib/lhci/lhci-result/" sudo cp -r $(ls -Art *.html | tail -n 1) "$WORKSPACE/lhci_report"
